Description: This rubric assesses student performance on the poem writing assignment. It focuses on creativity, use of language, and adherence to the specific poem form (if applicable).
Additional Notes: Note to the Instructor: * To adapt this rubric to a specific poem form, specify this in the Special Instructions box in the Advanced options. * Consider offering bonus points for originality, use of specific literary devices, or effective performance of the poem (if applicable). For assistance in identifying specific literary devises, use the Special Instructions box in the Advanced options.

Description: This rubric assesses student performance on the AP World History class project. The project focuses on developing analytical and research skills aligned with the AP World History curriculum.

This rubric assesses student performance on the 9th-grade global history course assignment. This assignment focuses on evaluating students' historical understanding, analytical skills, use of evidence, and writing clarity. This rubric is derived from the New York State Common Core Grades 9-10 Reading Standards for Literacy in History/Social Studies and Writing Standards for Literacy in History/Social Studies, Science and Technical Subjects.

This rubric assesses student performance on the 10th-grade literature course assignment. This assignment focuses on evaluating students' textual evidence use, theme development, character analysis, vocabulary use, structure, perspective, and writing quality. This rubric is derived from the New York State Common Core English Language Arts 9th-10th Grade Reading, Writing, and Language Standards.

This rubric assesses student performance on the 11th and 12th-grade creative writing assignment. This assignment focuses on evaluating students' idea development, use of language and literary techniques, character and setting development, plot and narrative structure, and style and voice. This rubric is derived from the New York State Common Core English Language Arts 11th-12th Grade Reading, Writing, and Language Standards.

This rubric assesses student performance on the 11th-grade U.S. history course assignment. This assignment focuses on evaluating students' use of historical evidence and analysis, identification of central historical ideas, evaluation of historical explanations and perspectives, writing clarity and coherence, and effective use of historical sources. This rubric is derived from the New York State Common Core Grades 11-12 Reading Standards for Literacy in History/Social Studies and Writing Standards for Literacy in History/Social Studies, Science and Technical Subjects.

This rubric assesses student performance on high school lab reports.
